description:
What is it?
We are working with the community to help
create a light rail transit system that will
connect downtown to world-class medical
centers. Central Campus to North Campus.
Plymouth Road to Main Street shops. All with
greater capacity. Greater comfort. More
sustainably powered. Faster, more reliable
service. And setting Ann Arbor up for the next
century.

These Open House Events will include
project staff and representatives from
the collaborating organizations to answer
questions and record comments.
We’ll provide an overview of the project to
date and the draft recommendations of
the consultant and Project Management
Committee.

Areas of discussion:
• Type of transit technology
• Configuration of the route
• Station locations
• Cost estimate
• Future expansion possibilities

This is the fourth in a series of public input
opportunities. Previous meetings were held in
December 2012, June 2013, and November,
2013.

For more information about the project, please
contact us at info@aaconnector.com
name: Connector Open House

description:
The Zell Visiting Writers Series Presents:

Lyrae Van-Clief Stefanon Q&A
Thursday, March 24th, 2pm
Hopwood Room

Lyrae Van-Clief Stefanon Poetry Reading & Book Signing
Thursday, March 24th, 5:30 pm
UMMA Helmut Stern Auditorium 

All events free & open to the public.

* * *
Lyrae Van Clief-Stefanon is the author of Open Interval, a 2009 National Book Award finalist,and Black Swan, winner of the 2001 Cave Canem Poetry Prize, as well as Poems in Conversation and a Conversation, a chapbook in collaboration with Elizabeth Alexander. Her work has appeared in such journals as African American Review, Callaloo, Crab Orchard Review, Gulf Coast, and Shenandoah, and in the anthologies Bum Rush the Page, Role Call, Common Wealth, Gathering Ground, and The Ringing Ear: Black Poets Lean South. She is currently at work on a third collection, The Coal Tar Colors.

For more info, please visit: https://events.umich.edu/event/26827
name: Lyrae Van-Clief Stefanon Poetry Reading & Book Signing

description:
Literati is thrilled to welcome Tom Bissell, reading from his latest, Apostle: Travels Among the Tombs of the Twelve.

In this profound and moving journey into the heart of Christianity, the widely acclaimed author of"The Disaster Artist"explores the mysterious and often paradoxical lives and legacies of the Twelve Apostles a book both for those of the Christian faith and those who want to understand it from the outside in.

Peter, Matthew, Thomas, John: Who were these men? What was their relationship to Jesus? Tom Bissell gives us rich and deeply informed answers to these ancient and surprisingly elusive questions. He examines not just who these men were (and weren't), but how their identities have taken shape over the course of two millennia. He makes clear that, ultimately, their story is the story of Christianity and its growth from an obscure Jewish sect to the global faith we know today. Bissell has visited holy sites from Rome and Jerusalem to Turkey, India, and Kyrgyzstan, and he vividly captures the rich diversity of Christianity's global reach. Written with warmth, humor, and rare acumen, Apostle is a brilliant synthesis of travel writing, biblical history, and a deep lifelong relationship with Christianity. The result is an unusual, erudite, at times hilarious book a religious, intellectual, and personal adventure.

Tom Bissell was born in Escanaba, Michigan, in 1974. He has lived in New York City, Uzbekistan, Vietnam, Italy, Las Vegas, Estonia, Portland, and currently lives in Los Angeles. In 2006 he was awarded the Rome Prize, and in 2010 he received a Guggenheim Fellowship. He has also done scriptwriting for several popular video-game franchises, including Gears of War, Battlefield, and Uncharted.
name: Tom Bissell

description:
JOIN THE MADNESS!
For the first time ever Aventura will be showing all of the happenings for March Madness.

Tipping off with Selection Sunday we invite you to make your own Aventura March Madness Bracket. Have a drink while you bounce ideas off our knowledgeable bartenders. 

Click the link in the "Tickets Available" section above to download and print your own Aventura Bracket. 

To enter, you must bring your Bracket into Aventura by March 14 at Midnight. $10 cash or credit gets you in the game, and the winner gets all in the form of an Aventura gift card.

We will announce the Bracket winner April 6.

EXTENDING THE MADNESS 
March 15, join the LIVE stream of each round in one of our VIP spaces, offering game day inspired food and drink specials.

BEVERAGES
Team Spirited Cocktail Specials
We will announce our team-spirited cocktails on game days

Game Day Happy Hour Specials
-$2 off Drafts
-$5 House Wines
-$5 Sangria

GAME DAY FOOD
Crispy Chicken Legs   
 with crunchy celery salad
     choose from: Lemon Pepper or honey harissa

Fried Michigan Cheese Curds
with romesco sauce

Smoked Whitefish Salad
name: Aventura March Madness

description:
Come celebrate Irish week here at babo!

We will be offering 10% off all green juices, Irish lattes, and beer on draft. 

And don't forget about our delicious Irish food specials!

See our menu below!

However, you will be celebrating we have options for you!

BABO IRISH WEEK
Monday, March. 14th –Sunday, Mar. 20th

FOOD SPECIALS

SANDWICH OF THE WEEK

CORNED BEEF SANDWICH
crust bakery rye, housemade corned beef, braised cabbage slaw, whole grain mustard, swiss cheese

ENTREE OF THE WEEK

RYE-CRUSTED CORNED BEEF
braised corned beef with toasted caraway, crust bakeries rye bread crumbs, topped with rich caraway gravy

VEGETARIAN ENTREE OF THE WEEK

BRAISED CABBAGE
slow braised cabbage, onion, and tomatoes seasoned with garlic, onion, thyme, and fennel seed

FEATURED SIDES

ROSTI POTATOES
shredded potato pancake filled with roasted shallots, thyme, and cheddar cheese

ROASTED ROOT VEGETABLE MEDLEY
carrots, parsnips, turnips, fennel, garlic, thyme, and Guinness stout glaze
name: Babo Irish Week

description:
All About Eve (Katie Geddes and Deb Wood) and Michael Krieger present the story of Good Friday, told through the music of Indigo Girls, Natalie Merchant, and Andrew Lloyd Webber, along with scripture and prayer.
 
                               30 minute service
                    repeats at 7:30pm and 8:00pm
            Enter at any time; stay as long as you like
              (worship service; no admission charge)
name: Good Friday Evening Vigil featuring All About Eve and Michael Krieger

description:
These shows are completely improvised, and star an impressive cast of experienced local improvisers, including our resident company The League of Pointless Improvisers.

Group 1: "The Real Thing" starring Nathan Corliss and Mat De Lisle

Group 2: "Doom and Doomer" starring Jeremy Conn and Jenny Bloomer

Group 3: "The League of Pointless Improvisers" starring Andy Reid, Jason Valentini, Matt Swartz, Matthew Flickinger, Mitch Socia, and Moni Jones
name: Pointless Improv with The Real Thing and Doom and Doomer

description:
BOARD+BREW: Number 25 !!!! 
where: Ground Floor @ 327 Braun Court Kerrytown 
when: Friday March 25th · 8pm-11pm
admission: nothing 
donation: zero 
bring: everyone!

We're once again having our pub game night, this time at the awesome new location -- Ground Floor space at Bar Braun Court. It goes from 7:30pm-11pm and we bring a large variety of games new and old. It is a very relaxed friendly crowd! Newcomers are welcome and encouraged. We've been doing this since November '13 and average a 25+ person turnout. xoxo

*New Library Games*
- Alien Frontiers - Thunder Alley
- Agricola: All Creatures - Mogul
- Pandemic: The Cure - Arboretum
- Masters Gallery - Airlines Europe
name: BOARD+BREW at Bar Braun Court
